content:
• Monday, May 14, 2012
  • OPNT-OLD

    More on Opnet Technologies (OPNT): FQ4 beats expectations across the board as higher product...

    More on Opnet Technologies (NASDAQ:OPNT-OLD): FQ4 beats expectations across the board as higher product sales helped offset the effect of temporary customer order delays that hurt its top line. Gross margin narrowed to 6.8% from 79.1% in the prior-year period. Shares +6.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:17 PM
  • PLAB

    More on Photronics (NASDAQ:PLAB): FQ2 beats EPS estimates despite an 11% Y/Y dip in overall...

    More on Photronics (NASDAQ:PLAB): FQ2 beats EPS estimates despite an 11% Y/Y dip in overall revenue for the quarter. Net profit actually rose as debt-extinguishment losses skewed year-ago results. Gross margin also continued to narrow, down to 25.4% from 27.4% in the year ago period. Shares +6.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:31 PM
  • RENN

    Renren (NYSE:RENN) reports a Q1 EPS loss of $0.01 on revenue of $32M, beating Street EPS...

    Renren (NYSE:RENN) reports a Q1 EPS loss of $0.01 on revenue of $32M, beating Street EPS estimates by $0.01 and revenue expectations by $2M. For Q2, the company sees revenue coming in below estimates at around $41M - $43M. Consensus estimates are for revenue of $46M. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • VOXX

    VOXX International (NASDAQ:VOXX): FQ4 EPS of $0.46 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.16....

    VOXX International (NASDAQ:VOXX): FQ4 EPS of $0.46 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.16. Revenue of $176.6M (+27% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares +1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • P

    More on Millennial Media's Q1: The company expects Q2 revenue of $37M-$38M and 2012 revenue of...

    More on Millennial Media's Q1: The company expects Q2 revenue of $37M-$38M and 2012 revenue of $173M-$176M, above Street estimates of $36.7M and $169.8M. Millennial claims it had 300M monthly unique users view its ads in March (140M in U.S.); that suggests the average user generated 10.7 cents in Q1 ad revenue. Pandora (NYSE:P) and Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) have reported seeing mobile ad monetization challenges (I, II) as well. MM -8.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • OPNT-OLD

    OPNET Technologies (NASDAQ:OPNT-OLD): FQ4 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $44.6M (+8.5%...

    OPNET Technologies (NASDAQ:OPNT-OLD): FQ4 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $44.6M (+8.5% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • PLAB

    Photronics (NASDAQ:PLAB): FQ2 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $117.5M (-11.7% Y/Y)...

    Photronics (NASDAQ:PLAB): FQ2 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $117.5M (-11.7% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • ZGNX

    Zogenix (NASDAQ:ZGNX): Q1 EPS of -$0.16 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $18.3M (+103% Y/Y) beats by...

    Zogenix (NASDAQ:ZGNX): Q1 EPS of -$0.16 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $18.3M (+103% Y/Y) beats by $1.2M. Shares +2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • SUMR

    Summer Infant (NASDAQ:SUMR): Q1 EPS of $0.07 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $58.5M (+7.7% Y/Y)...

    Summer Infant (NASDAQ:SUMR): Q1 EPS of $0.07 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $58.5M (+7.7% Y/Y) misses by $6.5M. Shares -27.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • GRPN

    More on Groupon's Q1: North American revenue +33% Q/Q to $238.6M, the fastest growth rate since...

    More on Groupon's Q1: North American revenue +33% Q/Q to $238.6M, the fastest growth rate since Q1 2011. International revenue +102% to $320.7M. Revenue equaled 41% of gross billings (40% in Q4). Active customers +140% Y/Y and +11% Q/Q  to 36.9M, over 100K merchants served. Free cash flow was $70.6M. better than net income of $16.3M. Accounts payable/accured merchants payable, a closely-watched figure, rose 10% Q/Q to $616.8M. GRPN +12.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • MM

    Millennial Media (NYSE:MM): Q1 EPS of -$0.05 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $32.9M (+53% Y/Y) beats...

    Millennial Media (NYSE:MM): Q1 EPS of -$0.05 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $32.9M (+53% Y/Y) beats by $2.9M. Shares -9.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • DVOXQ

    DynaVox (DVOX): FQ3 EPS of $0.06 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $24M (-16.4% Y/Y) misses by $4M....

    DynaVox (DVOX): FQ3 EPS of $0.06 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $24M (-16.4% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Shares +6.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN): Q1 EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $559.3M (+89% Y/Y) beats by...

    Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN): Q1 EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $559.3M (+89% Y/Y) beats by $28.5M. Gross billings were $1.35B (+103% Y/Y). Expects Q2 revenue of $550M-$590M vs. $559.3M consensus. Expects Q2 operating income of $25M-$45M. Shares +11.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 5 Comments
  • A

    Agilent Technologies (NYSE:A): FQ2 EPS of $0.78 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.73B (+3.3% Y/Y)...

    Agilent Technologies (NYSE:A): FQ2 EPS of $0.78 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.73B (+3.3% Y/Y) beats by $20M. Shares +4.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • CSOD

    Cornerstone OnDemand (NASDAQ:CSOD): Q1 adjusted EPS of -$0.10 in-line. Revenue of $24M (+52%...

    Cornerstone OnDemand (NASDAQ:CSOD): Q1 adjusted EPS of -$0.10 in-line. Revenue of $24M (+52% Y/Y) in-line. Non-GAAP gross margin of 74%, up 230 bps. Ended Q1 with 891 clients and about 8.2M users. Shares -2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • SFLY

    Shares of Shutterfly (SFLY -8.5%) fall back after Apple is reported to be set to add new photo...

    Shares of Shutterfly (SFLY -8.5%) fall back after Apple is reported to be set to add new photo sharing features to its next upgrade of iCloud.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM
  • CECO

    Career Education (CECO +4.2%) shares have slid 20% YTD as student enrollment trends worsen, but...

    Career Education (CECO +4.2%) shares have slid 20% YTD as student enrollment trends worsen, but BMO Capital is ready to call a bottom. The firm says the stock closed Friday near CECO's cash and investments balance, and given expectations the company will generate positive free cash flow and buy back stock, BMO believes further downside is limited.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • GEOKQ

    Geokinetics (GOK -11.2%) continues to plummet on the back of last weeks dismal Q1 result. Adding...

    Geokinetics (GOK -11.2%) continues to plummet on the back of last weeks dismal Q1 result. Adding fuel to the fire today was a downgrade to Neutral at Global Hunter, citing its disappointing backlog and FY12 guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • ROHI

    Shares of Rotech Healthcare (OTC:ROHI -43.3%) get clobbered after Jefferies throws in the towel...

    Shares of Rotech Healthcare (OTC:ROHI -43.3%) get clobbered after Jefferies throws in the towel and downgrades the shares to Hold and cuts its price target from $6 to $1.25.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • KMT

    Kennametal (KMT -2.7%) shares slide after reporting slower April order growth. Demand for the...

    Kennametal (KMT -2.7%) shares slide after reporting slower April order growth. Demand for the company's drill bits and cutting tools is closely watched since it tends to track industrial and mining activity, but falling demand for U.S. coal is particularly problematic for KMT. "We believe the next six months are likely to prove challenging for KMT," William Blair says.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • IMOS

    ChipMOS (IMOS +9.8%) soars following a positive Barron's column. The paper notes ChipMOS'...

    ChipMOS (IMOS +9.8%) soars following a positive Barron's column. The paper notes ChipMOS' impressive turnaround in recent years, and touts its strong free cash flow (expected to be $4/share this year), low valuation, and exposure to mobile component testing/packaging. A dividend and M&A interest are seen as future possibilities. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • UEPS

    Payment-system provider Net 1 UEPS Technologies (UEPS -5.91%) dips after Janney cut the shares...

    Payment-system provider Net 1 UEPS Technologies (UEPS -5.91%) dips after Janney cut the shares to Neutral today and sliced its valuation target by nearly 30% on the back of its FQ3 results and FY12 outlook on Friday. The firm notes that despite confidence in the company's ability to execute a newly won contract in its home country of South Africa, it says it doesn't feel comfortable with the "unit economics" of the deal, and prefers to move to the sidelines.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG -1.7%), in its interim corporate update, says two new producing wells...

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG -1.7%), in its interim corporate update, says two new producing wells in North Dakota's Polar Block further confirm a "prolific" core area. Thomas 15-33-28-1H3 showed an average cumulative production of 1,454 boe/day, while Thomas 15-33-28-2H came in at 2,033 boe/day.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 3 Comments
  • WYNN

    CLSA's Jon Oh has a take on the selloff in casino stocks that has continued unabashed in May on...

    CLSA's Jon Oh has a take on the selloff in casino stocks that has continued unabashed in May on risk-off trading and cut into impressive YTD returns for WYNN, MPEL, MGM, and LVS. The gaming sector analyst concedes that names in the group are easy to trim given their China exposure and high beta correlation, but he keeps a decidedly positive outlook for long-term growth potential for the industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 7 Comments
  • WPM

    Silver Wheaton's (SLW -5.7%) 20% Y/Y increase in earnings and 26% gain in revenues during its Q1...

    Silver Wheaton's (SLW -5.7%) 20% Y/Y increase in earnings and 26% gain in revenues during its Q1 isn't enough to satisfy investors, as both readings came in below expectations. CEO Randy Smallwood voices concern that "challenging global financial markets have made access to traditional forms of capital, such as debt and equity, much more difficult."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 4 Comments
  • RSG

    Republic Services (RSG -2.5%) trades down after Wedbush cut the shares to Neutral, noting flat...

    Republic Services (RSG -2.5%) trades down after Wedbush cut the shares to Neutral, noting flat volumes and competitive pricing have reduced the firm's expectations for margin expansion over the next 12 to 18 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • SKUL

    Skullcandy (SKUL +9%) jumps after a filing notes Principal Accounting Officer Ronald Ross bought...

    Skullcandy (SKUL +9%) jumps after a filing notes Principal Accounting Officer Ronald Ross bought 18K shares worth about $250K - an apparent vote of confidence after an underwhelming Q1. Morgan Stanley has a $21 target on SKUL, offering believers 50%+ upside.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • LEN

    Guggenheim raises its ratings on a slew of homebuilders to Buy today, saying the sharp decrease...

    Guggenheim raises its ratings on a slew of homebuilders to Buy today, saying the sharp decrease in existing home inventories has reduced exisiting home competition to a level supportive of order growth: Lennar (LEN +0.7%), Pulte (PHM -1.1%), Ryland (RYL -0.9%), Toll Brothers (TOL -0.6%), M/I Homes (MHO +1.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +2.1%) ticks higher after being upgraded to Buy at Goldman. The firm cites...

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +2.1%) ticks higher after being upgraded to Buy at Goldman. The firm cites share gains in its core markets and entrance into new therapeutic categories, which could accelerate revenue growth through 2015. It also raises its price target to $50 from $45.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • BMC

    BMC Software (BMC +8.9%) is up sharply after disclosing Elliott Associates' 5%+ stake, and its...

    BMC Software (BMC +8.9%) is up sharply after disclosing Elliott Associates' 5%+ stake, and its adoption of a poison pill in response. The fact Elliott took positions in Novell and Blue Coat Systems prior to their sales isn't lost on investors. JG Capital's Jeff Gaggin thinks Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) will make an offer for BMC in order to better compete with IBM in systems management software. BMC rival Quest Software (NASDAQ:QSFT) is currently up for sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • GRPN

    More on Groupon's (GRPN +14.7%) rally: In addition to short-covering, shares are getting a lift...

    More on Groupon's (GRPN +14.7%) rally: In addition to short-covering, shares are getting a lift from a bullish Benchmark note that argues the Facebook IPO could result in a "big rally" for Groupon. The firm also thinks Groupon will "meet or beat" Q1 estimates this afternoon and report improving cash conversion figures, though it's concerned about Q2 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • HOLX

    Hologic (HOLX +1.6%) ticks higher after JPMorgan ups the shares to Overweight. The firm says the...

    Hologic (HOLX +1.6%) ticks higher after JPMorgan ups the shares to Overweight. The firm says the upgrade was made to reflect compelling risk/reward and synergies from the Gen-Probe (NASDAQ:GPRO) deal. Its price target is also raised to $22 from $20.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +4.8%) jumps on an upgrade to Overweight at JPMorgan, citing the...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +4.8%) jumps on an upgrade to Overweight at JPMorgan, citing the drug developer's VX-809 opportunity. The firm also raises its price target to $82 from $45.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 4 Comments
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE -7.7%) continues its slide from last week after cutting FY12 guidance,...

    A123 Systems (AONE -7.7%) continues its slide from last week after cutting FY12 guidance, further pressured today by a downgrade to Sell on valuation at Craig-Hallum following the report. The firm says AONE's outlook remains cloudy and that business would need to ramp substantially to justify its current share price.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • CBOU

    Shares of Caribou Coffee (CBOU -4.7%) fall despite seeing an upgrade to Buy from Hold at...

    Shares of Caribou Coffee (CBOU -4.7%) fall despite seeing an upgrade to Buy from Hold at Dougherty. While analysts bang the drum that Green Mountain Coffee Roaster's inventory issues aren't necessarily indicative of structural problems at Caribou, investors for the most part have been wary that big names such as Starbucks and Dunkin' Brands pose as competitive threats.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • KEM

    Capacitor vendor Kemet (KEM -7.6%) adds to the big losses it saw on Friday thanks to a BofA...

    Capacitor vendor Kemet (KEM -7.6%) adds to the big losses it saw on Friday thanks to a BofA downgrade, which came a day after Kemet posted a FQ4 report featuring a weaker-than-expected gross margin. BofA is worried about a slow margin recovery, execution risk on account of restructuring and M&A activity, higher interest expenses, and macro uncertainty.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • CHK

    Carl Icahn will want something big in return for his anticipated stake in Chesapeake (CHK...

    Carl Icahn will want something big in return for his anticipated stake in Chesapeake (CHK +7.5%), and there's even less standing in his way than in his victory in taking control of CVR Energy, where he replaced seven of the nine members of CVR’s board. CEO McClendon owns just 1.78M shares worth barely $30M, and 13%-owner Southeastern Asset likely would welcome Icahn's involvement.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM | 12 Comments
  • SIRI

    Sirius XM (SIRI -2.8%) trades lower on growing concerns that Liberty Media's recent share...

    Sirius XM (SIRI -2.8%) trades lower on growing concerns that Liberty Media's recent share purchases (I, II) could be diluted by the company to as high as 367M shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 4 Comments
  • DAL

    Strange doing with shares of Delta Air Lines (NYSE:DAL) after trading is halted after the stock...

    Strange doing with shares of Delta Air Lines (NYSE:DAL) after trading is halted after the stock trips up circuit breakers on a relatively timid 1.1% upside move. Over 5M shares of DAL have already been swapped today in early action, although traders are madly tweeting that a fat finger trade could be behind the drama.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 1 Comment

  • Microcap drug developer Titan Pharmaceuticals (TTNP.OB +1.6%) gets a lift this morning after...

    Microcap drug developer Titan Pharmaceuticals (TTNP.OB +1.6%) gets a lift this morning after being initiated with an Outperform on valuation at Rodman & Renshaw.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • GME

    Shares of GameStop (GME +2.5%) swim upstream against a powerful current driving stocks lower,...

    Shares of GameStop (GME +2.5%) swim upstream against a powerful current driving stocks lower, helped along in part on chatter that the company could start selling lower refurbished MacBooks at retail stores.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • SPLK

    Splunk (SPLK +4.7%), which delivered a stellar IPO last month, is rallying on underwriter...

    Splunk (SPLK +4.7%), which delivered a stellar IPO last month, is rallying on underwriter coverage day. Credit Suisse (Outperform) expects demand for Splunk's software to surge in tandem with the exponential growth being seen in unstructured enterprise data. Morgan Stanley (Neutral) is also intrigued by Splunk's status as a big data pure-play, but is worried about its steep valuation (15x estimated 2013 revenue).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • SDRL

    Seadrill's (SDRL -1.8%) Q1 earnings fell 53% Y/Y, boosted by the sale of its Seawell subsidiary,...

    Seadrill's (SDRL -1.8%) Q1 earnings fell 53% Y/Y, boosted by the sale of its Seawell subsidiary, masking revenues that came in better than expected. The Norwegian oil services firm expects a boost in the current quarter from two ultra-deepwater rigs starting operations, as well as a full quarter of earnings from a jack-up rig that went into operation in March.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 2 Comments
  • MDVN

    Medivation (MDVN +2%) moves up this morning after Citigroup added the stock to its Top Picks...

    Medivation (MDVN +2%) moves up this morning after Citigroup added the stock to its Top Picks Live list and ratcheted up its price target to $129 from $90 after an upbeat meeting with management. Citi now believes enzalutamide's monthly price will be higher than expected, which will give a boost to margins in H212.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • GRPN

    Beaten-down Groupon (GRPN +12.1%) is rallying strongly ahead of this afternoon's Q1 report. With...

    Beaten-down Groupon (GRPN +12.1%) is rallying strongly ahead of this afternoon's Q1 report. With Groupon sporting a short ratio of 5.8 as of April 30, short-covering is likely playing a role. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • MWW

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (NYSE:MWW) fall back 5.8% after getting tipsy last week from reports...

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (NYSE:MWW) fall back 5.8% after getting tipsy last week from reports that LinkedIn and P-E firm Silver Lake were in the hunt to acquire the company. Though LinkedIn vehemently denies having any interest, apparently it got roped into taking a "courtesy" call from Monster's bankers at BofA - which was just enough to get the rumor mill churning.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • SYMC

    Symantec (SYMC -2.2%) heads lower on a downgrade to Sell from Goldman's Greg Dunham, who thinks...

    Symantec (SYMC -2.2%) heads lower on a downgrade to Sell from Goldman's Greg Dunham, who thinks declining margins and cash flow will drive shares lower. Dunham thinks "secular headwinds" in Symantec's core security and storage software businesses are limiting growth, and sees the company focusing more on lower-margin areas such as cloud software. He also sees competitive risks for Symantec's high-margin consumer security ops.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • MLCO

    Casino stocks open lower, with names tied to Macau and other Asian gambling regions feeling some...

    Casino stocks open lower, with names tied to Macau and other Asian gambling regions feeling some of the sharpest stings. The slow realization that mega-sized Asian resorts may take years to realize those mega-profits has been creeping into the thought space of analysts. Decliners: MPEL -5.6%, WYNN -3.1%, LVS -2.8%, PNK -3.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM | 3 Comments
  • PDCE

    Petroleum Development (PETD -3%) agrees to pay ~$331M to acquire liquids-rich assets in...

    Petroleum Development (PETD -3%) agrees to pay ~$331M to acquire liquids-rich assets in Colorado’s Wattenberg oil and gas field from an undisclosed seller, boosting its holdings there by nearly 50%. Assets include ~35K net acres for development, where current net production is ~2,800 boe/day. Separately, the company files to sell 6.5M shares of common stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • BONA

    Shares of Bona Film (NASDAQ:BONA) jump up 7.7% after New Corp. (NWS, NWSA) discloses that it...

    Shares of Bona Film (NASDAQ:BONA) jump up 7.7% after New Corp. (NWS, NWSA) discloses that it holds a 19.9% stake in the company. The investment will reduce CEO Dong Yu's stake in the firm to ~27%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • KR

    Cleveland Research downgrades Kroger (KR -1.9%) to Neutral from Buy due to the grocery store...

    Cleveland Research downgrades Kroger (KR -1.9%) to Neutral from Buy due to the grocery store operator's dim prospects for improving volume and margins. Following a common theme in the sector, Kroger has been riding price hikes to stronger revenue, while volume numbers remain under pressure.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • IAG

    Iamgold (IAG -4.3%) shares sink after the miner's Q1 results came in weaker than expected....

    Iamgold (IAG -4.3%) shares sink after the miner's Q1 results came in weaker than expected. Seasonal factors and mine sequencing headwinds are anticipated to continue in Q2 before results pick up in H2, Stifel Nicolaus says. Capital spending guidance for 2012 was slightly lowered to reflect construction delays at Essakane and Sadiola Deep Sulphide.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • ULTI

    Ultimate Software (ULTI +4%) makes new 52-week highs thanks to an upgrade to Buy and $100 PT...

    Ultimate Software (ULTI +4%) makes new 52-week highs thanks to an upgrade to Buy and $100 PT from Goldman. The firm cites major customer deployments, as well as improving spending trends in the cloud HR software space, which has seen a couple of high-profile acquisitions (I, II) over the last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM
  • NOK

    SocGen's Andy Perkins cuts his rating on Nokia (NYSE:NOK) to "sell" from "hold" and slashes his...

    SocGen's Andy Perkins cuts his rating on Nokia (NYSE:NOK) to "sell" from "hold" and slashes his price target to €1.80 from €3, saying that plunging handset sales, large operating losses and restructuring costs will burn into its cash pile, and "even bring into question Nokia's very survival." ADRs -4.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM | 29 Comments
  • ASMB

    Ventrus Biosciences (VTUS) +14.6% premarket after it says Phase III trials of its Diltiazem...

    Ventrus Biosciences (VTUS) +14.6% premarket after it says Phase III trials of its Diltiazem treatment for the relief of pain associated with anal fissures showed significant improvements over placebos. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • BAMM

    Directors at Books-A-Million (NASDAQ:BAMM) get slapped with a lawsuit from an investor over the...

    Directors at Books-A-Million (NASDAQ:BAMM) get slapped with a lawsuit from an investor over the sale of the company to existing shareholders. BAMM -6.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 2 Comments

  • Market preview: Greece remains in political deadlock and looks to be heading for new elections...

    Market preview: Greece remains in political deadlock and looks to be heading for new elections and then right out of the euro, sending shares of all sorts of national colors into the red. S&P futures -0.9%. Following news of varying degrees of seismicity, Yahoo +2.4%, Chesapeake +4.25% and Avon +5.5%, but Ancestry.com is -14%. Later: Groupon earnings
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • IOC

    InterOil's (NYSE:IOC) Q1 earnings and revenue surged but shares -13% premarket as the company...

    InterOil's (NYSE:IOC) Q1 earnings and revenue surged but shares -13% premarket as the company also says it received notice that the government of Papua New Guinea will reject its plan for a major new liquid gas project in the country. IOC has come under criticism from government officials for failing to abide by the terms of a 2009 agreement.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • NYT

    Shares of New York Times (NYSE:NYT) fall 7.3% premarket. On Friday, the company announced that...

    Shares of New York Times (NYSE:NYT) fall 7.3% premarket. On Friday, the company announced that it sold its remaining shares of Fenway Sports Group - the parent company of baseball's Boston Red Sox - for a cool $63M but it's wary comments from Barclays on the lack of a full time CEO at NYT that could be tipping trading sentiment.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • TIII

    Premarket gainers: TIII +43%. FRAN +7%. AVP +6%. Losers: ACOM -16%. IOC -12%.

    Premarket gainers: TIII +43%. FRAN +7%. AVP +6%.
    Losers: ACOM -16%. IOC -12%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:08 AM
